question: Describe the syndrome that is caused by biallelic variants in HPDL
ideal_answer: Biallelic HPDL variants cause a syndrome varying from juvenile-onset pure hereditary spastic paraplegia to infantile-onset spastic tetraplegia associated with global developmental delays.

snippets.text: Biallelic variants in HPDL cause pure and complicated hereditary spastic paraplegia.

Our findings suggest that biallelic HPDL variants cause a syndrome varying from juvenile-onset pure hereditary spastic paraplegia to infantile-onset spastic tetraplegia associated with global developmental delays.
Biallelic variants in HPDL cause pure and complicated hereditary spastic paraplegia
